item.title: Report E-2024120029
item.description:
Report E-2024120029

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Atlas Air
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6 November 2024 a class 8 shipment arrived from ATL. During the build up process of the ULD, one of the class 8 boxes was discovered leaking. The spill was contained to the ULD and floor of the warehouse. The affected area was closed off and cleaned in house. The internal packaging led to the leakage. The contributing factors were inner packaging material, temperature regulation, transportation towards the warehouse, and the actual slack composition/construction itself.

item.title: Report X-2024120195
item.description:
Report X-2024120195

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/03/2024 at approximately 1600 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 859604 at the ramp facility in Hebron, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consists of one composite box containing an aircraft part. The container appears to have given way under the weight of the inner contents and liquid began to leak from the bottom. The cause of the damage is unknown. The shipment is being held and awaits retrieval by the customer.
